context: The Finnish verb 'nousta' means 'to rise, get up', or 'to ascend'. It is an intransitive verb, meaning it doesn’t take a direct object. The word can be conjugated in various tenses and moods as shown in the dictionary definition. For example, 'nousen' means 'I rise', while 'olen noussut' means 'I have risen'.  It can also mean to increase or appear, like price going up ('Hinta nousi kymmenen euroa').
